intro: Gonolobus chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as a sprawling vine with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gonolobus chihuahuensis is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
